newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Swedish debt yields trade mixed with eye on U.S..
newsitem.headline: Swedish debt yields trade mixed with eye on U.S..

text.p: Swedish debt yields traded mixed in the early session on Tuesday.
Long debt yields fell a couple of basis points while shorter yields rose slightly. The market was waiting for U.S. consumer confidence data due out later on Tuesday.
"The market is very calm and is taking its cue from foreign markets," one dealer said.
"There has been some buying in the ten-year segment. But trading is mostly governed by someone needing to buy that segment," another dealer said.

A comment made by Finance Minister Erik Asbrink on television on Monday evening that there was no reason Swedish yields should be higher than in EU countries when EMU starts, might have lent suppport, dealers said.
Six-month T-bill rates rose one basis point to 4.13 percent.
Ten-year bond yields fell two basis points to 6.74 percent.
The crown was stable against the mark at 4.4750 compared to 4.4760 late on Monday.
